items.title: Hurricane Melissa Evacuees Return to Guantánamo Base
items.summary: The storm and the government shutdown halted court sessions and deportation operations at the outpost in Cuba for weeks.

items.title: New Passport Rule Sends Blunt and Sweeping Message to Trans Americans
items.summary: The Trump administration has said that the U.S. passports of transgender people must now reflect the sex on their original birth certificate, reversing a decades-old policy.

items.title: An Officer Bungled a Teen Rape Case. The Victim Was Abused Again.
items.summary: The investigator, who did not believe the teen, faced little punishment, illustrating the different ways that officers in New York State are disciplined for misconduct.

items.title: A Councilwoman Intervened During an ICE Arrest. Then She Faced the Voters.
items.summary: Months before the election, Etel Haxhiaj, a councilwoman in Worcester, Mass., was charged with assaulting an officer when she stood between the police and an immigrant family.

items.title: Trump Administration Escalates Pressure on Venezuela
items.summary: The Trump administration on Sunday placed an aircraft carrier in the Caribbean and announced it would designate a Venezuelan group as a foreign terrorist organization.

items.title: New International Student Enrollment Plummeted This Fall, Survey Finds
items.summary: The overall number of international students enrolled in U.S. colleges and universities, including those who enrolled in prior years or who are working after graduation, fell only slightly.

items.title: Trump continues to attack Marjorie Taylor Greene despite his call to release Epstein files – live
items.summary: <p>President repeats assertion that former ally is a ‘traitor’ even as he urges fellow Republicans to vote for release of documents relating to sex offender</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/17/trump-tells-republicans-to-vote-to-release-epstein-files-saying-we-have-nothing-to-hide">Trump urges Republicans to vote for release of Epstein files in surprise U-turn</a></p></li></ul><p>The president has pardoned for the second time a militia member involved in the Capitol riots, who had not been released from jail yet due to a firearms conviction.</p><p>Dan Wilson was already pardoned by Trump earlier this year, when the US president granted clemency on his first day in office to more than 1,500 Capitol rioters.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/17/donald-trump-jeffrey-epstein-files-republicans-democrats-world-cup-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump urges Republicans to vote for release of Epstein files in surprise U-turn
items.summary: <p>US president says he backs efforts to release documents related to late sex offender because ‘we have nothing to hide’</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/17/donald-trump-jeffrey-epstein-files-republicans-democrats-world-cup-us-politics-live-news-updates">US politics live – latest updates</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/12/jeffrey-epstein-donald-trump-timeline">How the Epstein row plunged Maga world into turmoil – a timeline</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/13/epstein-files-key-takeaways">Epstein emails: key takeaways from 20,000 pages of newly released files</a></p></li></ul><p>Donald Trump has told his fellow Republicans in Congress to vote for the release of files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in a sudden reversal of his earlier position.</p><p>The US president’s post on his Truth Social website came after the House speaker, Mike Johnson, said previously that he believed a vote on releasing justice department documents in the Epstein case should help put to rest allegations “that he [Trump] has something to do with it”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/17/trump-tells-republicans-to-vote-to-release-epstein-files-saying-we-have-nothing-to-hide">Continue reading...</a>
